body:
2024: December 

The US Census Bureau recently updated the county geos in Connecticut to reflect the names and geographic scope of current County-equivalent Planning regions. This change will be visible in Network360 as your projects are refreshed. Consider running benchmarking reports at the ZIP, county, and MSA level to be sure you understand how the changes affect your analyses. 



**These are the Connecticut Counties visible in Network360:**  

* Capitol County, CT  
* Greater Bridgeport County, CT  
* Lower Ct River Vly County, CT  
* Naugatuck Vly County, CT  
* Northeastern Ct County, CT  
* NW Hills County, CT  
* South Central Ct County, CT  
* Southeastern Ct County, CT  
* Western Ct County, CT  



For more details about the Connecticut changes, here’s a summary from the US Census Bureau: [2022 Geography Changes (census.gov)](https://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/acs/technical-documentation/table-and-geography-changes/2022/geography-changes.html). And more details, including a map that shows the old and new boundaries, can be found here: https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/FR-2022-06-06/pdf/2022-12063.pdf  



As part of this update, you might notice some changes to the Connecticut MSAs listed in Network360. We are working to ensure that all Network360 projects include this list of MSAs:  

* Bridgeport-Stamford-Danbury, CT 
* Hartford-West Hartford-East Hartford, CT 
* New Haven, CT 
* Norwich-New London-Willimantic, CT 
* Torrington, CT 
* Worcester, MA 



If you have any questions or need further clarification, feel free to reach out.
shortDescription: Announcement of Connecticut county names and geographies based on US Census Bureau update.
title: Update of Connecticut County Names and Geographies
